Description: Corroded iron mattock-head, with a central cylindric socket for the haft, a curved hatchet-blade on one side and a hammerhead on the opposite; made of a curved cylindric flat-tipped rod.
Curator's comments: One of "two pick-axes (...) of a form new to us (fig. 1), none like those found at Naukratis", mentioned by W.M.F. Petrie, Tanis ii, Nebesheh and Defenneh, p. 78 § 78, p. 110.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (p. 78 § 78, p. 110, pl. xxxviii, 1)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.46, p.47, p.76, p.185, pl.27)
Condition: Corroded and incomplete (fragment of the top edge of the hatchet-blade and hammerhead missing)
